definition: to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Chinese is not my mother tongue, so if I've written something wrong or offended someone, I wish all of you could excuse me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有什麼寫錯或者有得罪的地方，請諸位別見笑。

sentences.english: The following are the pictures of the day. No good shootings. Just view the way you like.
sentences.chinese: 下面是這天活動的照片，拍得不好，見笑了。

sentences.english: Just kidding. How can I compare myself with them?
sentences.chinese: 見笑，見笑。我哪兒能跟他們比？

sentences.english: Just kidding. How can I compare myself with them?
sentences.chinese: 見笑，見笑。我哪兒能跟他們比？

sentences.english: Code is written in a rough look not laughed.
sentences.chinese: 代碼寫的比較粗糙望不要見笑。

sentences.english: At the risk of showing my ignorance, how exactly does the Internet work?
sentences.chinese: 不怕讓你見笑了，可究竟互聯網是怎麼運作的呢？

sentences.english: When all the other flowers bloom, She just smile among them.
sentences.chinese: 括號裏的可以省略，還是很粗淺，見笑。

definition: to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to digress/to stray from the subject
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
